favourite.article: Amen! Out of bondage, sorrow, and night.

We sang this at the funeral of a dear and pious friend, who had left us early, when her family still needed her. I don't know whether she had requested it while she was ill: but I believe she marched across the Jordan.

I just returned from a retreat this past weekend which was a spiritually life-changing experience for me on a personal level. Tonight as I finished Night Prayer in front of Blessed Sacrament, I wanted a hymn to sing to Him that spoke what my heart was feeling. I typed into my iPhone 'night hymn' and this song from you was right there. Oh my, it could not have been more fitting for me at this time. It describes my retreat experience in every way way. I know Jesus chose it for me. Thank you so much!!

In the early hours of this day, as I was earnestly seeking the Lord... this song came to mind. As a young lad my dear mother would take up her accordion piano and play the old gospel songs including this beloved song, and we children would join in and song along. It was and yet today is impactful... I used my mobile and put the first lines of the song 'out of my bondage sorrow and night, Jesus I come' the song appeared... its lyrics touched me deep within and yes soothed my spirit. To God be the glory!
As part of the worship team I recall watching the whole congregation swaying back and forth in perfect rhythm as we all were soothed by this beautiful hymn. The words are wonderful.

I was in the kitchen making coffee and the Holy Spirit started singing "Jesus I come, Jesus I come!" So came over to the computer and turned it on and now I am writing it all down in my prayer journal. I will also share it with my friends in Maryland who love old hymns as I do. Thank you and God bless you.
Soul soothing song...

"Anything that disturbs rest in Him must be cured at once, and it is not cured by being ignored, but by coming to Jesus Christ." - Oswald Chambers God is so faithful to lead me back to this beautiful hymn and to read testimonies of His children from all over the world. He is Emmanuel!
Such a wonderful song with so much variations. I keep singing this over and over again. Praise the Lord.
Praise the Lord. There is hope. We can come to the Lord away from our various condition into God. Thank You Lord. Keep us coming to You.
I remember this hymn from when I was 12. Just caught myself humming it yesterday and here I am. What can I say, the hymn speaks to me!
This hymn came to mind in part and so glad to find all verses and then to read all the beautiful testimonies from the nations!! Praise God for His salvation in Jesus and for this lovely family.
I arrived early at the office and as I thought about my struggles with sin, this hymn came to my mind. I needed it to sooth me out of my sin and arrogant pride. Wonderful message.
A beautiful hymn that soothes and calms the nerves every time.

A few words of this song came to me during prayer - I remember it from my early days!!! Am amazed I can type in the bits I remember and it comes up so quickly !! Love it!! I just wanted that lift out of despair!!!! Praise God!

So grateful for this site. I have looked thru my many hymnals and old song books with no luck. Only remembering a few words makes it really tricky finding the hymn, but you did it in seconds. Thank you so much. Now I can get back to the settings where we sang it.
Woke up this morning with such a peaceful calm singing this beautiful song of praise. To God be All the Glory now & forevermore. =)

Alleluia! What comfort to know we can get our of all the negatives and find rest in the positives and more that our beloved Lord has to offer. This song has been and continues to be a source of tremendous blessing to me over the years.
Thanks to you for this great service that you provide.
Blessings!

I love this hymn indeed. Whenever I am seeking God's deliverance in any area of my life, I normally repent my sins and most of the time I am led by the Holy Spirit to sing this hymn. It really ushers me into God's presence.
I thank God for the pastor who started our Pentecostal church (which has grown into several assemblies for the last 15 years). This pastor was has since gone back to Canada was used by God to nurture the church members in walking in holiness and singing in hymns alot. I attribute my love for hymns to his mentorship. Glory be to God.
I absolutely LOOOVE this hymn! We sing it all the time in the young people's conferences! :)
Sure loved singing along with this song- awesome- thx...
This song spells out various aspects in our lives. I love Stanza 3 best. May the good Lord help us as we meditate upon the wonderful words.

Never usually put comments on websites! But looked up this hymn because I recently revisited a football ground in London, 29 years after attending a Luis Palau "Mission to London" rally as a student. As someone has commented on a Billy Graham rally, this hymn was also used at the altar call at the Mission to London. Thank God for the love and commitment of people who work tirelessly to share the salvation they have received with others.

The hymn reaches to the deepest valley within and uplifts the soul to the highest zenith. Thank You, Jesus, for Your sacrifice that makes these possible. The posted comments of others have multiplied my blessing.

Wonderful tune, beautiful lyrics composed many years ago yet I can relate with every piece of this music. It is among a collection of hymns I have been listening to lately, bringing me into total awareness of Christ's boundless love...
This song found me out. Out of my sorrows, loss, pride and self. Jesus, I come to Thee.
The words of this hymn are beyond description. It brings me into the light of my sinful ways where the grace of Jesus reached out for me.

This song has blessed me so often. I remember the Billy Graham Hour of Decision playing it at Billy's invitation for people to commit to Christ. I have recently seen several come to the Lord through witnessing to them. When I listened to the Gaither Homecoming sing this, I marvelled at how wonderful for these souls to so have the Savior. I am so humbled to be saved from my sins and brought into fellowship with God.
I first heard this song in 1985 and I still like it. Very encouraging.
As a teen in Choir in the 70's the song drew many souls to Christ. It always humble my soul am happy to get to have the whole verses again. Jesus is the same forever. Thank You for saving me Lord.

Love the words. We found the hymn while reading a Corrie Ten Boom book "In My Father's House" . The testimony of how beautifully God used this made me want to look it up. So glad I got to read all the verses. We'll have to have this at church soon!
A great hymn that reminds us that any time we try to come out of where we are, we are going to where Jesus is.
여기를 우연히 들어 왔습니다. 구글서치로 들어 왔는데요 정말 좋네요. 찬미를 듣고 있으니 마음에 평안을 얻습니다. 가사는 어려움과 환난 중에 있는 나인데도 말입니다. 감사합니다. 예수님.

I love this hymn, it has been a real comfort to me in the time of real trouble I am going through now. Even though I may be a failure, Jesus is my strength and my song, and my salvation. He is everything I am not and in Him I am so blessed! Alleluia!

Although Jesus is my Savior, whenever I sing this hymn there is always something that His finger points to in me. He is calling to come out, out, out! He wants to be the only One! All the positive items that are entered into are just Christ! It is not only a change of situation, or solving a problem, but it is Him!
